Fields.DialogueText: *ALARM*
Somers, what are we looking at?
A few targets that need our attention, Captain.
@BATTLE
Somers, give me a damage report.
Nothing we haven't seen before, Captain. The crew will do what they can.
We don't want any other Morganas picking up our scent a heading this direction.

Fields.MenuText: You're in such a chipper mood. More chipper than usual. What's going on?
What's up with the pep in your step, Somers? Found a nice bottle of wine?
The crew really responds well to your sunny disposition, Somers. What's going on?

Fields.DialogueText: Just another win for the good guys, Captain. Another day closer to victory and the end of the war.
A little fine wine does keep a gal like me in a good mood. I opened a very nice vintage the other night.
Everyone raved about the latest printing of my paper. That always puts me in a good mood.
Well, I'm liking it, Somers. You make this crew better.
Why, thank you. Always appreciate the compliments!
Of course. Keep on earning them.
Not a problem, Captain!
Hey, Captain. Get a load of these babies.
What, what are they? Where did these come from? Wait, where's Somers?
They're night vision devices, night optics. A new invention from Germany, and our special prize from the last merchant ship.
Wait, what? I think I'd remember these, and I sure didn't sanction them. Somers? Need you on the bridge, right away.
Aye, Captain. Reporting as ordered.

Fields.MenuText: Somers, where were these optics? Were you hiding them from me?
Why do we have unsanctioned cargo on my ship? I don't remember these on the cargo lists.
Somers, where did these come from?

Fields.DialogueText: Excuse me, Captain, I wouldn't hide anything on this ship. Please don't accuse me of such things.
You sanctioned it, Captain. Maybe you had a little too much to drink the other night?
The merchant ship we redirected a few days back. You really don't remember?
Smitty, you're dismissed. Somers, I really can't remember. And these... night optics? I'd remember these.
Yes, Captain.
Captain, you were--
*ALARM*
No time to talk about it now. Get our guns firing, Somers.
@BATTLE
I see you're keeping your uniform in top condition, as usual.
No two ways about it!
A sharp look sends the right message, Captain. Shows the crew that we run a classy joint.

Fields.MenuText: Is clothing really worth the time and effort? Our guns and engines matter more.
Where do you find the time to take such good care of your appearance?
Sets a good example for the crew to follow.

Fields.DialogueText: Dirty clothes one day, dirty guns the next.
Just takes a few minutes. If you make it part of your daily routine, it's a cinch!
They follow our lead, Captain!
Don't look too closely at my duds. Now I'm afraid I might have a loose button or two.
Looks fine to me, but I'm a whiz with a needle if you ever need a touch-up.
Sense that? Morganas incoming, Captain. Sounding the alarm.
*ALARM*
Let's iron these wrinkles out, Somers.
@BATTLE
Cup of joe? Might help you through that paperwork, Captain.
Thanks, Somers. Just reviewed our list of gear... and well... I definitely added the night optics to the manifest.
Aye, you did, Captain. Shame you didn't remember that until now.
We both had a few drinks, might I add.

Fields.MenuText: Wow, what a night, am I right?
Okay, uhm... let's make sure that we... or, I, don't drink before checking inventory, deal?
I only drink orange juice at the parties, Somers.

Fields.DialogueText: What a night indeed. Let's just make sure to drink after we deal with the spoils, okay?
You've got a deal.
We only serve orange juice mixed with vodka at the parties, Captain.
I'm handy with a typewriter if you ever want me to take minutes from our drinking nights, Captain.
Maybe not. I'd like to avoid ending up on your gossip pages.
A gossip rag? My paper? Ha! I've got journalistic integrity, you know.
As long as you know when to keep things off the record, Somers.
@BATTLE
I can see the headlines now...
"Captain Forgets Something, Remembers Later"?
Not exactly. Mine reads, "Morganas Arrive, Get Whipped!"
*ALARM*
*ALARM*
Another pack of Morganas?
I'm afraid so, Captain.
HQ says to expect quite a bit of resistance out here. The water here is crawling with these degenerates.
We'll deal with one group at a time, Somers.
@BATTLE
Take a breath, but make it fast. More BF on the radar, Captain.
Right. I'd prefer not to deal with that mess until we've gotten our current fires put out. Options?
I suggest we fire some smoke and make a getaway.

Fields.MenuText: Let's call it a withdrawal instead of a "getaway".
Don't think we can take them?
Good plan, Somers. We'll regroup and come back full force.

Fields.DialogueText: Aye aye, Captain. "Getaway" does make a catchier headline, though.
We've got a whole war to fight. Let's pick smart battles.
Calling it like I see it, Captain.
*ship wheels around behind a wall of smoke*
Nice work, Somers. Glad you're quick on your feet.
We live to fight another day.
Remind me to have a little toast at our next celebration, and that's an order.
Aye, Captain. I'll grab a pencil and make a note of that!
Ah. Maybe like this...
Oh, yes. Finally. Now it's just...
Hmm...

Fields.MenuText: Somers? Where are you? I could use you on the bridge.
Somers, you're not the type to stay out of the limelight for long. Are you okay in here?
Uhm... is this a bad time?

Fields.DialogueText: Just one... more... second..."... and they rode off into the sunset, never to return to the past again. The End." Done.
Hold on, Cap..."... but just as they were about to kiss, a shot rang off in the distance. The End." Ah, yes. Perfect.
Hmm... "They didn't always get along, but they knew when the going gets tough, their love always brings them back together"...  Finis.
So... what was that about?
I decided to write a chapter-by-chapter fiction piece for my paper. I just finished the first story, so the first chapter comes out tomorrow.
Huh. Smart idea, finishing the story all the way so you don't have to rush. The bit I caught sounded pretty interesting. But I guess I heard the last line, huh?
Well... since the paper runs once a week, you might forget while you read. This story sure is a doozy, with plenty of twists and turns.
You've already got me hooked. Since I'm, you know... the captain, mind if I just get a sneak peek?
I'm sorry, Captain. Not a chance in the world. You've already had an exclusive glimpse at the ending.
Ha. Fine, I can respect that. Hm... I'll just be first in line when they're out.
*ALARM*
I don't doubt it, Captain.
Incoming Morgana, Captain. Ordering the crew to battle stations.
@BATTLE
*typewriter clicks and clacks*
Hello there, Captain. How's the day treating you?
Oh, you know. After you've been awake for twenty-six hours or so, you catch your second wind.
Do you really?
No.
Would you like to change the subject?
Very much.
I have a chocolate bar I've been hoarding. I could probably be enticed to share.
Heh.
What am I missing?
Oh, nothing. Just... someone in your position hoarding candy bars. I must admit, if you don't mind, that I'm impressed by how restrained you are with your resources. Rare books notwithstanding.
What do you mean by that, Captain?

Fields.MenuText: You enjoy fine things, I suppose, but you don't brag about it. Eh, this isn't making sense, isn't it?
Er, did that sound rude?
You don't show it off like say... the diplomats we come across.

Fields.DialogueText: It's nice to stop and enjoy the finer things in life... especially during times like these... but I always make sure to give back. We can never forget those back home.
No, Captain. I'm thankful for the things I have, but giving back is what matters most.
I admit, I always enjoy what I have... but I give back to the people at home. The people always matter the most to me.
Well said. I always appreciate your insight. Makes you a good reporter, I suppose.
Oh, you. Thank you, Captain. Let's--
*ALARM*
An ambush!
Get us to battle stations!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Captain...
I see them.
You see some of them. I'm pretty sure more are incoming.
No running away from this group. Let's settle this as quickly as possible.
@BATTLE
Captain, our engines are running pretty damn hot.
Throttle down to control the heat. If we burn up, we'll be dead in the water.

Fields.MenuText: Get the fire hoses ready to keep the turbines cool. We can't slow down yet.
Time for some Belle magic, Somers. Keep us in one piece!

Fields.DialogueText: I'll give us as much speed as we can manage, Captain.
Will do, but that won't last long.
Doing everything I can to help, Captain.
Get us off the track of the next Morgana group. We need to lie low until we cool down.
Can't argue with that plan!
Okay... okay... I'll think of something... How are you holding up, Somers?
Still here, Captain. Morganas haven't put me on the shelf just yet.
If I didn't know better, I'd think today I might see you sweat, Somers.
Captain, they're charging at us.
Somers, check the radar.
Affirmative, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: This is insane. I know. I'm trying to come up with a plan.
Madness?? I'm going with madness. Okay just hold on a sec, let me think...
Nuts. Completely nuts. They can damage their ship as well, even sink it. Don't they know that? Okay, I need to think.

Fields.DialogueText: Captain, please hurry. We must act now.
I'd have to agree. Please, think quickly.
Sometimes we do what we must in order to win. We need to move.
Okay. I know what we're going to do.
Ready for orders.
*ALARM*
We call their bluff. We're tougher than they are, and we'll prove it to them. Right, Somers?
Aye, Captain. Glad you've still got the ice water in your veins!
@BATTLE
No more of this Morgana panic. Let's keep clear heads. Here's what we do...
*ALARM*
Somebody turn off the damn klaxon. Everybody knows we've got a fight on our hands.
Consider it done, Captain.
If we sound it every time there's BF contact out here, it would never go quiet.
@BATTLE
Somers? Update me.
Still alive and kicking, Captain. Might need a minute to fix up my hair, though.
Keep the damage reports coming, Somers.
I'll crack the whip. The engine room is hard at work.
Personnel? I want an update from sickbay, too.
Hart caught some shrapnel, Captain. Corpsmen are working him over with tweezers, but he should pull through.
Has he got a replacement on his turret?
Yes, Captain. Already arranged it.

Fields.MenuText: Glad you're on top of things, Somers.
Are you reading my mind? You're one step ahead on everything.
Next thing I know, you'll hand me...

Fields.DialogueText: We're both dancing to the same beat, Captain.
We're on the same sheet of music, is all.
... a cup of coffee? Got it covered. Careful, it's piping hot.
Feels like we're a well-oiled machine. Speaking of which, how are those engines?
Ha!
Another Morgana cluster ahead, Captain - and it looks like they're chewing on what's left of a freighter. Permission to scatter the vultures and liberate some of her cargo?
Then permission regretfully denied. We're still taking it easy on our main engines.
Captain, we could use those supplies. Medicine and some fresh food wouldn't hurt. Lure the bad guys our way with a distress call, then jump them when they get close?

Fields.MenuText: Wow... okay... remind me not to get on your bad side.
Huh. That isn't such a bad idea. If you say we can do it, then we do it.
You know, Somers, I'm liking this side of you.

Fields.DialogueText: Ha, I suppose she likes to come and play sometimes. Just sometimes, though.
Thanks, Cap. We're ready to go.
I won't spoil you with too much of a good thing, Captain. *wink* This side doesn't show her fangs much.
Sound the signal.
Deploying distress call.
*ALARM*
Hold... hold... fire..
This one's for the freighter.
@BATTLE
Can you make out any survivors?
Negative, Captain. I can usually tell, and... no, they're just gone.
Finally, a little rest and relaxation.
It sure is nice, isn't it? Watching the waves crash against the coast is exactly what the doctor ordered.
Oh? No shopping this time?
Hmmm, not this time. With all of those battles I'd rather just rest my, well, feet in the sand.
I'll drink to that.
And I'm... aaalready there.
And your poison for today is?
A classic gin and soda. A little heavy - but, my, is it delightful.
I didn't take you for a gin gal... you surprise me everyday.
I can't just lay all of my cards on the table. Though speaking of cards...

Fields.MenuText: Are you up for a round? I'm not sure you can take another beating... oh, was that too soon?
I see that you're ready to get your money taken. How about a little wager?
Oh you're on, Somers, as always. How about we make it a little fun?

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, undoubtedly. Let's up the stakes a bit and make it a bet, shall we?
Me? Get my money taken? Oh, no, no, no, Captain. Put your money where your mouth is.
By all means, what are you thinking?
All right, then. If I win... the crew gets to smoke tobacco on board without you running to me to file a complaint.
Really, Captain? Smoking? Oh this'll be fun... so what do I win, when I win?
When, huh? Hm... if you win... I'll help you with your paper. I'll write, you edit. And I'll pass it around myself, even.
Ohhh, yeah. This is good stuff. They should have a deck of cards around here. Get ready to lose, Captain.
Is that the last of them?
*BOOM*
Minus one. Let's clean them up!
@BATTLE
Another pack of Morganas incoming, Captain.
Roger that. Let them come in a little closer, and we'll blast away when they're in range.
Aye, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: Have our gunners wait until they've got a good bead on their targets.
Blast away. A big barrage always shakes 'em up.
Fire at will. I'll trust their judgement.

Fields.DialogueText: We keep an eye on the ammo, but I can't promise anything.
Cover your ears!
Excellent choice, Captain.
Let's go!
@BATTLE
Speedy little brats...
Huh?
Oh, aren't we a quick wit today, Captain?
Like scattering cockroaches. Happy to play the exterminators today.
Hey, hey, Goldie. How's it going?
It's going great. But please--
Hey, Goldie Gold! I'm looking forward to the next chapter. How could you end this one on a cliffhanger like that?
Thanks. But, please, the name is - Oh. Heya, Ensign Harrington...

Fields.MenuText: Somers. Do you have a moment?
Hey, Somers, are you busy?
Somers, why don't we talk for a second?

Fields.DialogueText: Ugh.
Eh...
Eugh...
Uhm... Somers? Hey, you two, what happened here? See where our Belle went?
We were...
Miss Somers? Um...
No wonder Somers left... If you two don't have anything to do, why don't you go and clean the latrines? Now.
Thank you, Captain.
*ALARM*
After this battle, take some time for yourself. Socialize later, captain's orders.
Yes, Captain. Thank you.
@BATTLE
I meant both of you.
Aye-aye, Captain...
Fans, am I right?
Oh, stop that. Calling them fans makes me somehow... responsible for them. Not as their Belle, but... you know what I'm getting at, Captain.
Okay... well, then... "Readers. Am I right?"
It's not like they were begging for an autograph... Was it that bad?
I do love being in the middle of it all. Right in the action, both in battle and around the ship. Plus, I'll always have topics for the paper... but...

Fields.MenuText: I can understand that, but you need to take a break now and then. Even for one minute.
Somers, that isn't good for you. And I'll be damned if I don't have the best Belle on the seas.
I can't order you to take breaks every day, you know. I don't like pulling rank ALL the time.

Fields.DialogueText: A minute is enough? Okay, I can do that.
Ha. All right, All right. I'll make sure to make myself some time. I appreciate the talk.
Unless of course you're trying to sucker-- I mean, take everyone for their money. Or trying to get sneak peeks on the next chapter. But... you're right. I'll make sure to take them.
Good.
@BATTLE
Enjoying those cigarettes, Foreman?
Yes, Captain, I am. Really calming the nerves. How'd you get Somers to agree with this, anyway?
I'm a woman of my word. We bet on it when playing a dashing round of poker. Your gallant captain won, fair and square.

Fields.MenuText: That's right.
You're very welcome to join us next time, Foreman. How about it, Somers? A round with the crew would be entertaining.
A woman of her word, indeed. But she really didn't expect such a defeat.

Fields.DialogueText: Ha! Psst - I know you cheated once or twice...
Let's play at the next party. And this time, I'm all in.
Oh, Captain, please don't get used to it.
Until next time, then. Foreman, are you picking up anything on the radar?
Aye, Captain. I just got a read. We have Morgana contacts dead ahead.
Roger that. Let's turn up the heat, Somers. Full speed ahead.
Aye-aye, Captain.
@BATTLE
You might want to finish that smoke quickly, Foreman. No cigarettes at battle stations!
Ha! Yes, thank you, Ambassador. A quick wit like yours ensures events like this are never dull! Please, enjoy the wine and hors d'oeuvres.
Just delightful, my dear. Oh. I heard that cheese is a must have. And are those Greek olives?
How did that go, Somers? Hopefully not like shaking hands with a Morgana.
Just lovely. After dealing with business, we talked about the newest trends on the global market. Quite sharp.
It seemed like you two were getting along. I didn't even see you grimace once at the ambassador's cigarette.
Good! I honestly thought I wouldn't make it.

Fields.MenuText: You could've have dazzled 'em with your phantom appearance. Probably would've tried to bring you back home.
You're a ducky gal, Somers, even if it's around something you can't stand.
Grin and bear it.

Fields.DialogueText: Can you even imagine? And think of the headlines. "Phantom Belle on the Rise. See her on the magazines and walking on the runway." Ha.
I don't know how I do it sometimes, Cap.
She had four. Within several minutes. Let me just... move over here.
Much better, the air's a little fresher here.
*ALARM*
Get the Ambassador belowdecks. The rest of you, battle stations!
@BATTLE
Eat as many as it takes to convince you, Ambassador. Pardon me, if you would...
I don't recognize that label. Do you have a new source for wine, Somers?
It's a gift from an Italian Belle. My sisters are thoughtful, aren't they?
Huh. Make sure to thank her for me, will you? And see if we can get her something in return. I want all the friends we can make out here.
Will do. I made sure to mention it in the paper, too.
So remember that bet we placed? Even though I won, of course, I'd still be up for helping out.
Really, Captain? Do you even have time?

Fields.MenuText: I can make time, Somers. Besides, the paper can use a little... oomph.
I'm all for a little writing, Somers. I can find time.
I'm not afraid to stay busy.

Fields.DialogueText: Oomph?! It has enough... oomph. If we give you an extra special feature, would that be enough oomph for you?
That's... that's great, Captain. Okay. Maybe we can have a daily quotes page. Maybe say something motivational for each week.
All righty then.
Sounds good to me. We'll touch bases after you uh... start it. It's your paper, you're in charge.
Ah... so I'm the captain now, eh?
Don't get ahead of yourself.
Hehehe, fine, Captain - but beware! My typewriter moves at flank speed...
Better put it somewhere safe in the meantime.
@BATTLE
Tell me, Captain, what are you like in battle?
You don't know already? How many battles have you fought at my side on this ship?
Let's try this - any lucky rituals or things you do first? I'm sure our readers would like to know.

Fields.MenuText: A shot of whisky and a quick prayer.
I keep a lucky coin in my pocket. Just knowing it's there helps for some reason.
Nothing special. I just call out the orders and get everyone to their battlestations. That step focuses my attention, and I'm ready to fight.

Fields.DialogueText: Maybe we edit out the drinking... Don't want the crew to get the wrong idea.
So not necessarily a magic talisman, but more of a reassuring comfort. Got it!
Not exactly interesting, but... you say it quite well.
Any more questions?
Nope. That's all for now, Captain. This interview will be a hit. Great idea.
You think so? Thanks. Glad to help, honestly.
You're a natural, Captain.
Whenever you need a photo to go with it, I'm "ready for my close-up, dah-ling"...
Yeah. Keep that one off the record.
@BATTLE
Oh noo. Oh no, oh no, oh no..
Somers. What's going on?
My pistols. They're gone. Just... gone. I sat them down for one minute and they're gone.
Somers, wait. Your dueling pistols?
(pathetic nod)
I see.
(pulls herself together) There, enough of that. I just need to conduct a little search, and the problem will be solved.

Fields.MenuText: They have to be around here somewhere, I'll help you look okay?
I'll have the crew keep an eye out, all right?
Dueling pistols gone adrift... how bad could that be? On a ship full of sailors who get bored and will play with anything they can get their hands on...

Fields.DialogueText: I really appreciate it, Captain.
Thank you, Captain. I'll write a notice in the next issue...
Try not to make it any worse, Captain.
All right, come on.
*ALARM*
Morganas! Sorry, Somers, but we'll have to postpone. Let's take care of business.
Aye, Captain.
@BATTLE
I sat them down after I cleaned them near the mess hall...
I'm sure you've looked there, but let's go back. We start our coordinated search from there.
I haven't found anything yet. How about you, Somers? Any luck finding your pistols?
Luck's definitely not on my side at the moment.
I know it's not the same, but... we might find some great ones at the marketplace. Next time we dock, I'll take a look.
Captain, I just wanted to say... not only do you lead us well, but you care about us, too.

Fields.MenuText: Whenever I can personally lend a hand, I try and take it.
Permission granted to scold me if that ever changes, Somers.
The ship is nothing without a crew. Taking care of the crew is my job.

Fields.DialogueText: Lifts my own morale hearing that, Captain.
Even if you conveniently forget that statement down the road, I won't!
Great to hear, Captain. I'll add that line to your section of the paper.
Let's move northwest, avoid the heavier waves from that storm.
Any leads?
Not a single, solitary one.
*ALARM*
We've got something else unpleasantly rolling in to ruin a day, too!
@BATTLE
Rogers. Call for Miss Somers, will ya?
Aye, Captain.
Wanted to see me, Captain?
Have a seat, Somers.
Sounds like you're about to interview me. Ask away, but no photos until I have a chance to press this outfit.
I wanted to ask... does being called Goldie still bother you?
I... honestly I haven't given it much thought lately.

Fields.MenuText: Are you still opposed to it?
What do you think about it?
Well, is it a go or a no?

Fields.DialogueText: Eh... I suppose not. I might still let a grimace slip through here and there, but-- Wait, why do you ask?
Becoming accustomed to it. I'm doing trying this new motivational phrase "Be Who You Are." I recite it daily in the mirror.
I suppose it's a go - though I'm still getting used to it.
I realize I should have asked you earlier, but I--
*ALARM*
You know what? I think it can wait. Let's move.
Whoa! But what? Can't you quickly tell me first? Why did you ask? Captain?
@BATTLE
Wow, check out these lights!
Somers has done it again. Transforming our mess hall into something classy...
Ahem.
Uh... sorry, Captain.
I'm glad you all like it. Enjoy yourselves, the night is yours. Except don't even think about smoking in the non-smoking areas...
Yes, ma'am.
Champagne?
Oh, of course.
Diiiid s-ssomebody say chammmpagne? I'll have... I'll have 'nother of those.

Fields.MenuText: I think you've had enough. Take the lampshade off your head.
That's a bench, not a bunk. Time for that partygoer to call it a night!
Whoa! Quit trying to water the plants, and stow your--

Fields.DialogueText: Agreed. Here, sailor. Let me take that glass from you. Have some water instead.
I'll have someone help him to his rack, Captain.
No need to snap, Captain. He's just having a little fun. I'll make sure we mop that up.
Oh, Miss Goldie! You're such a lovely... such... a... yeah... I'll have... a water...
Smart call, my good man.
*ALARM*
We'll take care of the people who partied too hard, Captain.
Great job, Ensign. You and one other keep an eye on things. Somers, let's move.
@BATTLE
Party crashers...
*ALARM*
Do my eyes deceive me?
Just one Morgana? I didn't think we were allowed to have it this easy.
@BATTLE
A moment of peace, finally.
I'll say cheers to that. So, Captain... about the crew calling me "Goldie"... Can we do something official about that nickname?
Ah. I understand it's a touchy subject for you, but I was hoping that these would make it better.
Oh!
Well?
My pistols. You... they... Oh my! They're painted with "Goldie" along the barrels... and the script is beautiful, Captain.
We've come a long way, Somers. I hope you can accept a token of my appreciation. Well, two of them.

Fields.MenuText: Ah, hell. Don't cry. Please? Those are happy tears, right?
I know I should've asked to borrow them, but I wanted it to be a surprise. So... surprise?
Do you like them?

Fields.DialogueText: Ha. Yes, they're happy tears. An amazing gift, Captain.
Ha. Surprise indeed, Captain. Thanks so very much. I love them.
This is possibly the best gift I've ever received. I don't want to sound pretentious, but I love these possibly even more than the book... ah! Don't mind me - I'm just flabbergasted.
I can't wait to see them in action.
Don't fall for it, Captain. Watch the mist. Where there's one, there are always more.
Well, congratulations! You've done it. Now the name "Goldie" is a point of pride!
I was torn between "Goldie" and "Somers," but... nobody but your crew calls you "Goldie." It just seemed more personal. I apologize if I got that wrong.
*sniff*
Can't thank you enough, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: I had to show my appreciation somehow.
I'm sure you're a crack shot with them, just like your other guns.
Just don't wave 'em around too much. I don't want an accident.

Fields.DialogueText: You hit the mark, Captain.
I could shoot the olive in a martini from fifty paces, Captain.
Trust me, Captain. I know how to handle things.
Hey, Goldie. Nice shootin' back there.
Nice shooting, Goldie.
More and more people are calling you that every day.
I'm at peace with it. We've come a long way now, Captain. We're friends. You're more than welcome to give it a shot.
Okay... Goldie.
*grin*
You had me going!
I heard you've been showing the pistols off to the crew, Somers.
We really are a great team, aren't we, Captain?
*ALARM*
Going straight to the bridge, thanks to the BF. Get me close enough, and I'll show the Morganas my pistols, too!
